data.title: The Conversion of Mary Magdalene by Paolo Veronese, Luke 8:1-3, Bible.Gallery
data.meta_description: The Conversion of Mary Magdalene is an oil painting, an early work by the Italian Renaissance artist based in Venice, Paolo Veronese (1528–1588). He was known for hi...
data.text:
Luke 8:1-3

Luke 8:1

Soon afterwards, he went about through cities and villages, preaching and bringing the good news of God’s Kingdom. With him were the twelve,

Luke 8:2

and certain women who had been healed of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out;

Luke 8:3

and Joanna, the wife of Chuzas, Herod’s steward; Susanna; and many others; who served them from their possessions.
